paragraph: Jennifer "Jen" Turner is a singer/songwriter musician and producer.
== Career ==
=== 1991–1997: session and touring guitar player ===
section: == Career == | === 1991–1997: session and touring guitar player ===

paragraph: She first became popular for her work writing and touring with Natalie Merchant
section: == Career == | === 1991–1997: session and touring guitar player ===

paragraph: on her multi-platinum album Tigerlily as guitarist and backing vocalist
section: == Career == | === 1991–1997: session and touring guitar player ===

paragraph: alongside Peter Yanowitz on drums and Barrie Maguire on bass guitar. She then went on to play acoustic guitar on the Mary J Blige album Share My World.
section: == Career == | === 1991–1997: session and touring guitar player ===

paragraph: In 1997, Jen was invited by Miles Copeland III to join Soraya's live band on guitar.
section: == Career == | === 1991–1997: session and touring guitar player ===

paragraph: In 1997 she formed the band Furslide alongside bassist Jason Lader, and drummer Adam MacDougall
and released their album Adventure
on Virgin Records,

recorded in London's Metropolis, Olympic and Abbey Road studios. Jennifer Turner broke from Virgin to form an independent record label, Caboose Music, a subsidiary of the Virgin group. In 2001, using Inner
as alias she released two records on her own independent record label. Inner's first release was the EP Dog Demos followed by the full-length album Lovetheonlyway the year after.
=== 2007–present: band member, producer and engineer, actor ===
section: == Career == | === 2007–present: band member, producer and engineer, actor ===

paragraph: Through the middle of the 2000s she kept a lower profile mostly working in bands but not as frontperson.
section: == Career == | === 2007–present: band member, producer and engineer, actor ===

paragraph: Starting 2006 she worked with Joseph Arthur and the Lonely Astronauts, played guitar in Santigold’s band and joined Here we go magic playing bass and keyboard. Turner produced and engineered the band's 2010 Album Pigeons and 2011 The January EP.
section: == Career == | === 2007–present: band member, producer and engineer, actor ===

paragraph: The same year Jennifer Turner and Henrietta Tiefenthaler, both having a faible for Krautrock founded Thrillionaire
section: == Career == | === 2007–present: band member, producer and engineer, actor ===

paragraph: – with Joey Waronker, Cedric LeMoyne and Marius de Vries taking part.
section: == Career == | === 2007–present: band member, producer and engineer, actor ===

paragraph: In 2012 she formed Exclamation Pony- consisting of Ryan Jarman as lead guitarist & vocalist and Jen Turner on bass & vocals, releasing a single on Julian Casablancas label Cult Records.
section: == Career == | === 2007–present: band member, producer and engineer, actor ===

paragraph: Also in 2012, Turner played herself in the movie/biopic Greetings from Tim Buckley.
section: == Career == | === 2007–present: band member, producer and engineer, actor ===

paragraph: In 2015 Taylor McLam (drums, vocals) and Chris Traynor (Guitar, Vocals) started working on some music together. Jen Turner (guitar, vocals), Gabriella Da Silva (Vocals), Drew Broadrick (Piano, Vocals) and Sibyl Buck (Bass, Vocals) joined in, forming High Desert Fires.
section: == Career == | === 2007–present: band member, producer and engineer, actor ===

paragraph: They released their first EP in 2015.
section: == Career == | === 2007–present: band member, producer and engineer, actor ===

paragraph: Also in 2015 she joined the lineup of The Lemonheads for several tours, garnering rave reviews for ‘invigorating the band’.
section: == Career == | === 2007–present: band member, producer and engineer, actor ===

paragraph: In 2012 the British music magazine NME did a feature on ‘dream band line-ups’, where Turner was named as a bass player, one of the only contemporary musicians on the list.
section: == Career == | === 2007–present: band member, producer and engineer, actor ===
